Please read the following text and indicate whether you agree to participate and proceed with the survey.¬†  ¬†   	I am voluntarily participating in this survey for the BFH Generative AI Lab.¬† 	I am aware that I will not receive any financial compensation for my participation.¬† 	The data from this survey will be used to investigate the use of generative AI in the workplace.¬† 	I am aware that the survey is anonymous and that no conclusions can be drawn about the participants.¬† 	No information will be collected that allows conclusions to be drawn about my identity or my place of work unless I voluntarily provide such information in one of the available comment fields.¬† 	The data collected will be used exclusively for publications in the context of this research project and any follow-up projects.¬† 	I am aware that I cannot be contacted directly to view the final report, as the survey is anonymous.¬† 	The contact person for this survey is Yannis Schmutz (yannis.schmutz@bfh.ch).¬† [I agree]

column46: We are very strict about only using AI in presentations and not in the final product unless this is specifically briefed by the client. AI is especially helpful for moodboards and mockups, but in regards to designing a final product or campaign we use the help of AI but never let it be fully done by it. When it comes to text, AI does not have the affinity to write as detailed or adapted to the situation and emotional as we need it to sell our ideas to the clients. It is certainly a good help but usually it is still easier to write the things yourself to get a satisfying outcome.

column46: As with all new technologies that change current workflows (think computers, internet) there are many people who don't want to engage. Change is perceived as bad. AI is change, AI is bad. So one part of this group will adapt in the future and the other part will be left behind. Newer companies, with younger workforce will have an advantage. Smart companies know that, so the gap between the two will grow. All this will have a great impact on our economy and society within the next 5 years.

column46: I believe that the next major revolution will happen in less than a year, or around a year, when all of us will have access to generative AI capabilities from our smart phones, such as Apple, that will be a game changer. Imagine an instant access to all the worlds information when you were living your daily life I don‚Äôt think any of us predict how that is going to transform the world, and what the world is going to look like in two years after this capability is released.. Just as it is no longer necessary for small children to learn how to use a pen and to write beautiful text as they did many years ago, I think that it will be increasing less that we spend time when we are children, learning facts and figures, because those facts and figures will be instantly at our disposal whenever we need them. So I think this will have a revolution on the topics that we teach to children probably it‚Äôs a good thing, because we will be able to spend more time focusing on social skills and just learning stupid things such as the year and what your person was born or what day of the week a world war started on

column45: I see the benefits in AI in research, presentations and more, where AI can help making information more interesting and fun and gets us away from boring power point presentations, where people fall asleep. Additionally, AI should be implemented together with automation processes to help the employee to concentrate on more sophisticated tasks.
column46:
Lots of people fear AI (me included) for example deepfake, where AI can be used for something negative like many things. TNT was introduced to help building railways through the mountain and then was used to blow up safes in a bank.
Airplanes are built to transport people until someone had the idea to fly it into WTC.
Therefore my question is, how can we identify, that something was done by human and something else by AI?
